prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.7469] Sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw two rectangular faces in the sketch with the following properties: * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point at [0.0, 0.0], End Point at [0.1618, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point at [0.1618, 0.0], End Point at [0.1618, 0.0311] - Line 3: Start Point at [0.1618, 0.0311], End Point at [0.0, 0.0311] - Line 4: Start Point at [0.0, 0.0311], End Point at [0.0, 0.0] + Loop 2: - Line 1: Start Point at [0.0031, 0.0031], End Point at [0.1587, 0.0031] - Line 2: Start Point at [0.1587, 0.0031], End Point at [0.1587, 0.028] - Line 3: Start Point at [0.1587, 0.028], End Point at [0.0031, 0.028] - Line 4: Start Point at [0.0031, 0.028], End Point at [0.0031, 0.0031] * Face 2: + Loop 1: Same as Loop 2 of Face 1. Scale the sketch with a factor of 0.1618. Extrusion Extrude the 2D sketch in the positive normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.0031 units. The final shape will be a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The length of the prism is 0.1618 units, the width is 0.1618 units, and the height is 0.0031 units. Part 2: Joining a Solid Body The second part consists of joining a solid body to the first part. Coordinate System Use the same coordinate system as Part 1: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.7469] Sketch Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Same sketch as Part 1, since we are joining the same solid body. Extrusion Extrude the 2D sketch in the negative normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.7469 units. This will join the solid body to the first part, resulting in a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a total height of 0.7469 units. The length and width of the rectangular prism remain the same as Part 1, which is 0.1618 units. The height is now 0.7469 units, accounting for the solid body added in this step.</description>
